Package pieces

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
Piece is an abstract class which provides basic fields/methods for chess pieces.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Integer> columnMappings
    The characters in columnMappings are mapped to an integer representing the column
    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> rowMappings
    The integers in rowMappings are mapped to another integer representing thw row

      isWhite - determines color of piece
      didMove - determines if piece moved or not

  • Method Details

    • validMove

      public abstract boolean validMove​(Board board, java.lang.String move)
      validMove checks if the move made by a player can be made
      Parameters:
      board - Chessboard object
      move - User-inputted move
      Returns:
      true if the move can be made

    • isKingInCheck

      public abstract boolean isKingInCheck​(Board board)
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where game is played on
      Returns:
      true if king is in check

    • canThisPieceDie

      public boolean canThisPieceDie​(Board board)
      canThisPieceDie checks if a piece can be killed by another piece
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where game is played on
      Returns:
      true if piece can be killed by another piece

    • diagonalKill

      public boolean diagonalKill​(Board board, int rank, int file)
      diagonalKill checks if a piece can be killed by a queen or a bishop
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is played on
      rank - rank of piece
      file - file of piece
      Returns:
      true if the piece can be killed by a diagonal move

    • straightKill

      rank - rank of piece
      file - file of piece
      Returns:

      endRank - rank of piece

    • getColor

      public boolean getColor()
      getColor gets the color of the piece
      Returns:
      true if piece is white, false if its black

    • didItMove

      public boolean didItMove()
      didItMove checks if piece moved
      Returns:
      true if piece moved, false if it didn't
